definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

sentences.english: A bad padlock invites a picklock.
sentences.chinese: 一個劣質的掛鎖引發一個撬鎖者。

sentences.english: For more information about the security, you can click on the padlock.
sentences.chinese: 你可以點擊掛鎖瞭解跟多的安全信息。

sentences.english: He hacked the padlock off the door.
sentences.chinese: 他把門上的掛鎖砸掉了。

sentences.english: Dropping the bag to the ground, I pulled out the key to the Dumpster’s padlock.
sentences.chinese: 我把垃圾袋丟在地上，然後掏出鑰匙開垃圾箱的掛鎖。

sentences.english: Locked flash drive will protect your data from unauthorized access.
sentences.chinese: 掛鎖優盤可以防止你的數據被越權存取。

sentences.english: They had put a padlock on the door of his flat.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經在他的公寓門上上了把掛鎖。

sentences.english: I remember padlocking the gate when I left for the post office.
sentences.chinese: 我記得離家去郵局時用掛鎖把大門鎖上了的。

sentences.english: The ward lock is the easiest to pick and now is used only for cheap padlocks .
sentences.chinese: 病房鎖是最容易的選擇，現在只用廉價的掛鎖。

sentences.english: The metal ladder has the diaphragm with padlock device and alarm nameplate .
sentences.chinese: 金屬梯設置帶掛鎖設施和警告銘牌的隔板。

definition: ring pull (can)/strap handle (on bus or train)/circular door handle
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to return something to its rightful owner
